intro: Petrocoptis crassifolia subsp. pardoi, commonly known as the broad-leaved petrocoptis, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its robust, upright growth habit and large, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
